definition: a narrow street (lined with walls)/to line the street
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to line the streets in welcome

sentences.english: Since Feiyunge hole north, tree-lined lined, stone-level stretching.
sentences.chinese: 自飞云阁洞北望，林荫夹道，石级绵延。

sentences.english: The people lined the streets to hail the returning heroes.
sentences.chinese: 人们夹道欢迎凯旋的英雄们。

sentences.english: We threaded our way through the tables.
S. and British troops were greeted as liberators in the capital of Kabul.
sentences.chinese: 英美联军作为解放者在首都喀布尔受到夹道欢迎。

sentences.english: The home-coming hero arrived in town and was greeted by the crowd gathered along Main Street.
sentences.chinese: 英雄凯旋回到故乡小镇，受到群众在大街旁夹道欢迎。

sentences.english: People lined the streets to watch marathon.
sentences.chinese: 人们夹道观看马拉松赛跑。

sentences.english: There is no question of a spontaneous mass welcome in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 大量群众自发的夹道欢迎似乎并不可能。

sentences.english: Chinese flags wave in the crowd as the Pope passes by.
sentences.chinese: 中国五星旗在夹道向教宗鼓掌欢呼的人群中挥舞。

sentences.english: When he came to Toronto, in Canada, there were 500 000 people in the streets to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 当他到达加拿大多伦多时，受到50万人的夹道欢迎。

definition: to line the streets in welcome
winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
promenade/long hallway/Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京頤和園|北京颐和园[Bei3 jing1 Yi2 he2 yuan2]
